definition: to fight desperately (at the risk of one's life)
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch

sentences.english: Players jostle and collide realistically while trying to win balls.
sentences.chinese: 球員們在爭奪球時真實地拼搶。

sentences.english: Many small and medium-size Chinese businesses are highly leveraged and have to scramble for cash.
sentences.chinese: 很多中國的中小型公司都借高利貸得去拼搶現金。

sentences.english: This indicates the harshness of your team's tackling within a match.
sentences.chinese: 這項表示你的球隊在比賽時的拼搶強度。

sentences.english: When does jostling for position become a foul?
sentences.chinese: 拼搶什麼時候成了犯規？

sentences.english: Without work experience, young job seekers will need to scramble for options, he said.
sentences.chinese: 沒有工作經驗，年輕的求職者被迫拼搶任何一份工作。
